subject: Pedals
description_text:
A few months ago I bought your pedals from Amazon. Today I moved my chassis
and the RJ connection from the accelerator to the control box ripped off. I
bought the pedals in April from Amazon, so I don’t think I would be able to
get it replaced. Would I be able to at least get a confirmation on which RJ
connectors are used to reconnect it? Unless this is covered still.

Please see attached photo of proof of purchase.


Devon Kakabar

conversations.body_text: Hi Devon Kakabar,  No need to worry. Could you please provide a photo of the broken connector? We can send you a replacement throttle sensor free of charge, or you could have a new RJ11 connector crimped at a nearby computer repair shop.

This is the connector that is broken. Would there be any issues getting a
new one crimped? Or is the safer bet to just get a new sensor?

Devon Kakabar




On Sat, Jul 26, 2025 at 10:17 PM service@simsonn.com

I think getting a new throttle sensor would be the best solution for my
situation.

Devon Kakabar




On Sat, Jul 26, 2025 at 10:35 PM Devon Kakabar <devonkakabar33@gmail.com>
wrote:

> This is the connector that is broken. Would there be any issues getting a
> new one crimped? Or is the safer bet to just get a new sensor?
>
>
> Devon Kakabar
>
>
>
>
> On Sat, Jul 26, 2025 at 10:17 PM service@simsonn.com
What actions do I need to take in order to get a new throttle sensor?
Hi Devon Kakabar,  Here is the tracking number of the new throttle sensor : JSEGI2838266299YQ. You can track it via https://www.js-exp.com/EN/index.php?page=19.

Thank you so much! You have provided great service and a great product.

On Tue, Jul 29, 2025 at 11:08 AM service@simsonn.com

Hello,

After I received the new throttle sensor, I plugged it in and I have
discovered that there is another issue...

I plugged it in and it was saying that the throttle was being compressed at
100% I tried to restart my pc, unplug the pedals, recalibrate. I took it
all back apart and noticed that the cable was not in as far as on the old
sensor and it looks as if there is a wire that is cut internally.

Could I be sent another in order to mitigate this issue?

Please see photo attached.

Thank you,

On Tue, Jul 29, 2025 at 11:09 AM Devon Kakabar <devonkakabar33@gmail.com>
wrote:

> Thank you so much! You have provided great service and a great product.
>
> On Tue, Jul 29, 2025 at 11:08 AM service@simsonn.com
Hi Devon Kakabar,  Alright, I will arrange for our operations team to send you a replacement. The damage was likely caused during shipping.

Thank you so much! No worries, things happen.

Devon Kakabar




On Wed, Aug 20, 2025 at 10:19 PM service@simsonn.com

Is there an update on this being shipped?

On Wed, Aug 20, 2025 at 10:19 PM service@simsonn.com
Hi Devon Kakabar,      It might have been overlooked by the operations team. She mentioned that today she will pack some items and resend the throttle sensor.
Hi Devon Kakabar,  Here is the tracking number: SF6045912069246. You can track it viahttps://www.sf-international.com/cn/en/support/querySupport/waybill
